segments.text: Hello everyone, welcome to today's Tara Talk on May 9th. I am today's host, Hong Shi-an.
We are honored to invite Xu Ruifu to speak for us today.
Xu Ruifu is currently a research assistant at the Chinese Academy of Sciences.
He will be entering the PhD program at NTU in September.
His main research is on micro-fine-graining and material studies.
Today's topic is the Ultimate Challenge of Antenna Miniaturization.
Before we start, let's give the speaker a round of applause.
Before we start, please remember to turn on your microphones.

I have been concerned about the current situation.
In the past 10 years, the number of PhD students in Taiwan has dropped from 20,000 to 15,000.
At this point in time, people will be thinking about whether there is a need to adjust the way we nurture PhD students.
Whether there is a need to gather more resources to nurture our young researchers.
In addition to doing academic research, I am also concerned about this public policy.
